title: Organ-Aware Multi-Stage Medical Image Segmentation (UNet++)
description: Developed medical image segmentation CV models for lung pneumothorax (SIIM-ACR) and brain MRI FLAIR (LGG segmentation), achieving Dice 0.84 and 0.91 respectively. Implemented a lightweight routing classifier to dispatch images to these models automatically with perfect accuracy.

title: SemEval 2026 Task 5: AmbiStory Word Sense Plausibility
description: Built a transformer-based NLP model for SemEval 2026 Task 5 to predict human plausibility ratings (1–5) for word senses in ambiguous narrative contexts. Achieved .73 combined score on the SemEval leaderboard using fine-tuned DeBERTa and novel dynamicly weighted hybrid CORAL + MSE loss.

title: Graduation Project: AI Research Gap Finder
description: Developed an AI-powered end-to-end framework to automate Systematic Mapping Studies (SMS) using LLMs and Model Context Protocol (MCP) framework. Automates months-long SMS process of research paper retrieval, screening with snowballing, topic extraction and classification, and knowledge graph construction.

title: Personal Portfolio Website
description: Built a modern, professional portfolio website featuring dark mode, responsive design, and smooth animations. JSON-driven content architecture for easy maintenance, deployed on GitHub Pages with automated CI/CD pipeline.

title: Spatial Analysis of Political Disorder in Kenya (1997–2024)
description: Analyzed 16,225 ACLED political violence and protest events (1997–2024) using spatial geometry and OpenStreetMap data. Demonstrated accessibility gradient in political disorder with riots concentrated near major roads and battles in remote regions.

title: GitHub Developer Network Analysis
description: Analyzed 1.9M GitHub users and 3.9M follower relationships using GPU-accelerated cuGraph and NetworkX. Investigated whether programming language diversity correlates with social network centrality using PageRank, betweenness, and community detection metrics.

title: WitchCraft: AI-Assisted CV Management Tool
description: Created a CV-management tool that enables quick creation of professional, tailored, ATS-friendly CVs with AI assistance if needed.

title: HowUDoin: Mobile Messaging App
description: Developed a Java messaging app using Gradle, Spring Boot and MongoDB for backend and React Native, Android Studio, Expo CLI for frontend.

title: Stock Price Prediction Using Linear Regression
description: Created a model to predict Nvidia (NVDA) stock prices using trends from correlated stocks Microsoft (MSFT) and Broadcom (AVGO). Analyzed US stock market data (2019–2024) for market insights.

title: Understanding Ethnicity Using Photographs
description: Built an image classification CV model in my first year of CS to predict ethnicity from photographs using a dataset of individuals from the GCC, Egypt, and Levant regions.

title: Effective Goggles: Drone Network Simulation
description: Developed a distributed environmental monitoring simulation with networked sensors, intermediary drones, and a central server, implementing TCP-based communication, real-time statistical analysis and anomaly detection, battery lifecycle simulation with automatic recovery, and optional GUI-based system monitoring.

title: Sentiment Analysis of IMDB Movie Reviews
description: Developed a comprehensive sentiment analysis pipeline for the IMDB movie review dataset (50K samples), implementing and evaluating Logistic Regression, BiLSTM with GloVe embeddings and attention, and fine-tuned BERT models, achieving up to 91.5% accuracy and 0.971 AUC, with systematic cross-validation and detailed performance–efficiency trade-off analysis.

title: Zad à Dos: E-commerce Web App
description: Developed a full-stack e-commerce web application for men's luxury bags using MySQL, Node.js, Express.js, and React, following a client–server architecture and Scrum Agile methodology.

title: Database System Using SQL and Firebase
description: Implemented CRUD-based web applications integrating MySQL and Firebase, including the design of a relational database for a computer parts shop with ER modeling, SQL schema implementation, triggers and stored procedures, a web-based database interface, and a real-time customer support portal.

title: Electronic Air-Hockey Game on an FPGA
description: Designed and implemented a two-player electronic air-hockey game on an FPGA using Verilog, modeling puck motion and game logic via finite state machines, with real-time interaction through LEDs, seven-segment displays, buttons, and switches; implemented timing control, debouncing, score tracking, win conditions, and demonstrated the complete system on hardware.
